visualization_prompt: Generate a solidgauge chart showing a single data point exceeding axis limits using gradient color encoding and angular pane configuration

title.text: Solidgauge data overflow past full circle (#2997)

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains a single numerical value (38) representing an engineering measurement exceeding normal operational limits. Synthetic data was generated to demonstrate gauge overflow behavior, with the value intentionally set 760% above the axis maximum (5) to test visualization boundary conditions. The solidgauge chart effectively employs Cairo's preattentive processing through radial position and color gradient encoding. Tufte's data-ink ratio is maximized by removing non-essential elements (gridlines, minor ticks). The red-green gradient (μ=16.5, σ=23.5) creates intuitive danger/safety zones, while the arc background (innerRadius=60%) prevents visual crowding. Angular configuration (-90° to +90°) converts linear scale to radial geometry, maintaining proportional interpretation despite data overflow.
